case_title: CHAIRMAN, RAILWAY BOARD vs MUHAMMAD ARSHAD and others
reference_no_or_id: Civil Petition for Leave to Appeal No. 1782 of 2001

accussed_details.name: Muhammad Arshad
accussed_details.designation: Assistant Engineer, Pakistan Railways Headquarters at Lahore
allegation: Refunded Rs. 1,89,771 to contractor in violation of provisions of standard Specifications for Execution of Works/1967, Railways Composite Schedule of Rates/1990, and Special Conditions of the contract, causing loss to the Government exchequer.

complaint_summary: Muhammad Arshad was accused of causing a loss of Rs. 1,89,771 to the government exchequer by violating provisions of railway specifications and refunding the deducted amount to a contractor.
investigation_summary: Departmental inquiry proved the charge against Muhammad Arshad, leading to his dismissal from service on 2000-01-25 and an order for recovery of Rs. 1,89,771.
judgment_summary: The Federal Service Tribunal modified the penalty from dismissal to withholding of promotion for 3 years after a junior was promoted, while maintaining the recovery order. The Supreme Court granted leave to appeal to consider the contentions raised by the petitioner, including the time-barred nature of the respondent's appeal and the Tribunal's justification for awarding a minor penalty.
punishment: Recovery of Rs. 1,89,771 and withholding of promotion for 3 years.
Decision_or_verdict: Leave to appeal granted; operation of the impugned judgment suspended.
legal_arguments: The respondent's appeal was time-barred and lacked an application for condonation of delay.
The Tribunal's justification for awarding minor penalty based on the first instance of corruption was challenged.
statutes: Standard Specifications for Execution of Works/1967
sections: Para 807 of State Railway General Volume
key_issues: Violation of railway specifications causing financial loss.

legal_terms.Corruption: Abuse of public office for private gain.

words_and_phrases.Shrinkage allowance: Deduction applied to measurements for uncompacted earthwork.

summary_vector_notes: The case involves allegations of corruption against Muhammad Arshad, an Assistant Engineer at Pakistan Railways, for refunding Rs. 1,89,771 to a contractor in violation of railway specifications. The Federal Service Tribunal modified his dismissal to withholding of promotion for 3 years while maintaining the recovery order. The Supreme Court granted leave to appeal to examine the contentions raised by the petitioner, including the time-barred nature of the respondent's appeal and the Tribunal's justification for awarding a minor penalty.

facts.respondent_position: Assistant Engineer, Pakistan Railways Headquarters at Lahore
facts.charge: Refunded Rs. 1,89,771 to the contractor in violation of provisions, causing loss to the Government exchequer.

result.penalty_modified: Withholding of promotion for 3 years after a junior is promoted

contentions: First instance of corruption is not justification for minor penalty.
Appeal was time-barred and no application for condonation of delay was filed.

legal_reference.case: Zafar Ali Shah v. General Pervez Musharraf
legal_reference.definition: Corruption is defined as the abuse of public office for private gain.

observations.tribunal: First instance of corruption and amount involved being less than Rs. 2 lacs deemed minor.
observations.court: Courts have a vital role in eradicating corruption within legal parameters.
